about.title: About Us
about.description: We are a company dedicated to excellence

aboutUsPage.heading: Together, we are building the foundations of a regenerative future, one hub, one corridor, one community, one story at a time.
aboutUsPage.sasText:
Founded in 2020, INHABIT develops innovative legal, economic, and educational tools focused on protecting vital ecosystems and driving rural social innovation. INHABIT creates social business solutions that effectively engage diverse stakeholders in land use change, biodiversity conservation, and biocultural activation.

On the ground, INHABIT implements ecological corridors at both small and large scales, ecosystem restoration, urban and Artscape projects, along with initiatives focused on land security, rural transition, and rural social innovation.

INHABIT is a pioneer in developing tools to expand the corridor globally, such as the land tenure framework for biocultural Hubs. This approach facilitates the creation of a regenerative, functional, and equitable land tenure model and introduces an innovative ReFi model for decentralized finance that seeks to involve everyone in this mission.
aboutUsPage.foundationText:
The INHABIT Foundation is a non-profit organization designed to serve as the legal body of a new land tenure framework that effectively enforces the Rights of Nature and the Rights of Earth Stewards, as well as stewardship-based regeneration principles in specific territories.
The Foundation supports 'Rural Change Agents'—farmers, individuals, and organizations—by securing land tenure, providing restoration funding, granting access to education, and fostering a supportive community around them, enabling their role as catalysts for long-term regeneration, ecological and cultural resilience, climate justice, and locally-led territorial governance.
aboutUsPage.teamSubtitle: We are purpose-driven entrepreneurs, farmers, artists, facilitators, Experts in law, restoration, technology and rural development, united to reinvest ways of inhabiting Earth

team.name: Luca Urbano
team.role: Social entrepreneur and farmer with 13 years experience in regenerative business development, ecosystem restoration, agroecology, agroforestry, social and inclusive supply chains. Grew up in Congo, established the first Moringa supply chain based on food forest systems. Co-founder of several social businesses focused on food and IT.

team.name: Chiara Trotto
team.role: Bachelor of Social Sciences in cooperation and development, facilitator and trainer in project formulation, social entrepreneur, 13+ years of experience in sustainable agro-food chains, social innovation, and non-formal education with communities in Europe, Africa, and Latin America.

team.name: Dror Noi
team.role: Social entrepreneur and permaculture designer passionate about decentralized and regenerative cultures/agriculture. Grew up in Israel, established the first center for Social Innovation in TLV. Co-Founder of Yumajai & Partner at Inside-hub. Manages a permaculture farm in Colombia.

team.name: Talya Weinberg
team.role: Global impact strategist, social clown, and integral artist, expert in ecosystemic and human regeneration. Co-founder of Yumajai and Heart Spaces methodology, integrating art, ecology, ancestral wisdom, and education to inspire global change.

team.name: Amelia Maria Carrillo
team.role: Attorney with a Master's in Territorial Studies, experienced in environmental law and legal territorial protection frameworks from a biocultural perspective. Founder of the Foundation of Mother Earth operating across Colombia.

team.name: Junior Rojaas
team.role: Senior developer and entrepreneur with 11+ years in software development, specializing in blockchain and cryptocurrencies. CTO of Futswap and CEO of Intechchain, leading projects in decentralized finance and technological solutions.

team.name: Gaia Pagano
team.role: Bachelor of Social Sciences, Master in Innovation and Development, Human Rights and Culture of Peace. Coordinator at Pontificia Universidad Javeriana, 12+ years in peace and reconciliation, intercultural relations, and dialogue projects with indigenous and Afro-descendant communities.

team.name: Juan Pablo Lievano
team.role: Economist and MA in anthropology with 13+ years of experience in sustainable rural development, climate change, project management, and financial evaluation of small farmer agribusiness models. Founder of two natural reserves in Colombia.

team.name: Mohamd Ibrahim
team.role: Network and satellite communications engineer, ICT expert for over 20 years. He grew up in Congo (D.R.) where he founded several Internet service providers, earth stations and data centres that brought reliable, redundant, secure and affordable connectivity to Africa. Expert in Cybersecurity, hosting, System Administration, Network routing and optimization, blockchain engineering and Artificial Intelligence.

team.name: Celia Mercado
team.role: 10 years of experience as an eco-psycho-social transformation facilitator. Industrial engineer, Master in Rural Development, and specialized in Transpersonal-Integral Psychology. She leads sustainable projects and fosters inclusive initiatives within rural communities in Colombia. With the INHABIT Foundation, she actively co-creates biocultural methodologies and supports territorial regeneration through community-based stewardship strategies.

team.name: Juan Diego Agudelo
team.role: A developer with 4 years of experience specializing in real-world asset tokenization and blockchain interoperability. His work focuses on process traceability, capital distribution, and asset tokenization. Committed to blockchain for good, he designs systems that support the creation, collective governance, and long-term stewardship of physical commons, fostering regenerative, community-driven economies.

team.name: Fernanda Herrera
team.role: Visual designer with 12 years of experience in the field of digital project development, working as UI and UX designer for websites and applications, many of these websites have been fully developed from the conceptualization phase of the design to the code development itself, usually using Html5, css3 and basic javascript or CMS like wordpress, webflow, etc. I have basic knowledge in frameworks such as vue, react, angular, python and ruby on rails, microintreactions and advanced web animations.

hubsMain.heading: The first three HUBS are located in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, considered the Heart of the World.

nuiyanzhi.label: Knowledge Center for Restoration
nuiyanzhi.title: ÑUIYANZHI
nuiyanzhi.description: Since 2021, the family of Amelia, Juan, and their son León have lived and cared for Ñuiyanzhi in partnership with the Kogi elders of the Kaggaba tribe, from the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.
nuiyanzhi.visionText: The Ñuiyanzhi Hub is a living laboratory where ecological restoration meets ancestral knowledge. It regenerates soils degraded by overgrazing, monocultures, and agrochemicals, creating a biodiversity hotspot for endangered species. As a training center, it combines hands-on learning with indigenous and academic wisdom.

aguaDeLuna.label: Biodiversity Hotspot
aguaDeLuna.title: Agua de Luna
aguaDeLuna.description: The Agua de Luna hub is a sanctuary for rare species and a center for research and education, combining modern science with indigenous wisdom.
aguaDeLuna.visionText: The Agua de Luna Hub is dedicated to preserving the world's largest rainforest, supporting local communities, and fostering global collaboration for conservation.

TierraKilwa.label: Desert Innovation
TierraKilwa.title: Tierra Kilwa
TierraKilwa.description: The Tierra Kilwa hub pioneers sustainable living in arid environments, focusing on water conservation and renewable energy.
TierraKilwa.visionText: The TierraKilwa Hub demonstrates how life can thrive in extreme conditions, inspiring new solutions for a changing climate.

items.question: What makes the Nuiyanzhi Hub unique?
items.answer: The Nuiyanzhi Hub is a living laboratory where ecological restoration meets ancestral knowledge, combining indigenous wisdom with modern science.

items.question: How can I become a guardian of Nuiyanzhi?
items.answer: You can become a guardian by acquiring a Stewardship NFT for Nuiyanzhi and participating in our restoration and stewardship programs.

items.question: What are the main objectives of the Hub?
items.answer: The main objectives are ecological restoration, knowledge exchange, community participation, and sustainable land management.

items.question: Can I visit the Nuiyanzhi Hub?
items.answer: Yes, NFT guardians and stewards have exclusive opportunities to visit, learn, and participate in hands-on experiences at the Hub.

highlight.title: WHAT ARE NFTS?
highlight.description: Stewardship NFTs are blockchain-verified contracts that give fractional rights to protect ecosystems on tokenized plots of land

photo.section1: By purchasing an NFT you become a lifelong guardian of a specific Hub, allowing you to monitor and participate in important decisions affecting these ecosystems, and gain exclusive access to biocultural experiences, events, workshops, visit the hubs, and explore the entire Corridor.
photo.section2: The funds raised from these NFTs are used to acquire degraded lands and transform them into biocultural Hubs. These areas are protected under the INHABIT land tenure framework—a pioneering model of nature reserves that grants legal rights to nature, redefining land protection and stewardship to a new level.

infographic.landTenureDescription: A groundbreaking model of natural reserves that recognises nature as a legal entity with rights, and provides specific rights and benefits to individuals who support the permanent protection and regeneration of these biodiversity hotspots.
infographic.nftStewardsDescription: People from anywhere in the world can become lifelong protectors of nature, with the ability to monitor, safeguard, and access these thriving hubs, along with numerous benefits as they travel the Corridor.
infographic.natureDescription: Nature is considered an entity with rights within the land boundaries, according to the Declaration of the Rights of Nature (e.g., the right to self-regulation, restoration, protection, decision-making...)

testimonial.quote: Inhabit is a powerful expression of how decentralized tools can support nature stewardship communities. It is one of the most concrete manifestations of the green crypto research we have done at Ecofrontiers and it is inspiring to see it come to life.

faq.title:
Frequently Asked
Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about our ecosystem protection and stewardship programs.

items.question: Is the INHABIT corridor a real physical corridor?
items.answer:
Yes — the INHABIT Corridor is a real and growing network of biocultural hubs that span the globe, each a physical place. Led by changemakers, these hubs restore ecosystems, revive ancestral knowledge, and are tasked with the mission to create a continuous corridor that connects key restoration sites within their bioregion. Each NFT represents a real, active hub — minting one forges a real piece of a corridor that crosses the Earth!
Corridors are not only physical structures but living systems—dynamic, interdependent, and essential for the survival of both human and non-human communities. They facilitate the exchange of biodiversity, seeds, and living knowledge on a global scale. As critical "infrastructure" for present and future generations, corridors enable biodiversity to thrive, adapt, and regenerate.

items.question: What makes a Hub a biodiversity hotspot?
items.answer:
A biodiversity hotspot is a space with exceptionally high levels of biological diversity that is also under significant threat from human activity. Bio-cultural Hubs function as "living seed hubs"—spaces of critical ecological importance, designed to safeguard and propagate life across the Corridor.
Much like a regional botanical garden, but rooted in the native ecosystems only, each Hub serves as a vital node in a broader network - fostering ecological connectivity across the larger fabric of the Corridor. These hubs allow both people and pollinators to act as living carriers of biodiversity, naturally dispersing seeds, knowledge, and regenerative practices throughout the landscape.
At the heart of each Hub lies an Inner Corridor—a designed ecological pathway that:
Connects fragmented or degraded landscapes,
Provides refuge for endangered species,
Supports the flow of genes, species, and cultural knowledge,
And strengthens both local resilience and global ecological connectivity.

items.question: What exactly is a Stewardship NFT?
items.answer:
Imagine having a special contract in your digital wallet—a bit like a passport or deed—that shows you are part of something real. It's not just a picture or a token. It's a key. It gives you lifelong rights and tangible benefits linked to a specific piece of land, along with access to the intrinsic value being regenerated on the ground.

The contract is securely and permanently stored on the blockchain, meaning it can't be lost, altered, or faked. Each NFT is unique—like a piece of art—and only a limited number are issued for each land. It's a digital asset with real value that can be transferred.

In addition to securing your rights in relation to the land, the NFT encapsulates the entire legal framework that protects the land itself. It reflects and protects both the Rights of Nature and the role of human stewards, through a groundbreaking model that redefines what land ownership means—shifting it from control to care, from possession to responsibility.

Many believe stewardship will shape the future of economies—and the Inhabit Stewardship NFT is one of the first tools making that vision tangible, linking value creation to care, regeneration, and shared responsibility.

items.question: What rights and benefits do I receive as an NFT holder?
items.answer:
The Stewardship NFT grants you lifetime membership and a living bond between you and a biocultural HUB.
Their unique offerings, may include:
  • • Legal rights as a protector of a Hub
  • • Exclusive artworks
  • • Free accommodation and on-site workshops
  • • Immersive biocultural experiences
  • Participation in DAO governance
  • • Access to tools to monitor the real impact of your contribution
  • • Exclusive educational contents
  • Airdrops
  • ...and much more

items.question: What makes the Inhabit NFT unique and different from conventional NFTs?
items.answer: Unlike purely digital NFTs, Inhabit's Stewardship NFTs are rooted in real lands and living ecosystems. The land—and your relationship to it—is protected by an innovative legal framework that grants you rights and tangible benefits over a physical territory and access to the intrinsic value being regenerated on the ground. More than a online digital collectible, each NFT is a portal to real-world impact and movement—designed to cultivate offline relationships between people, places, and the ecosystems they help bring back to life.  It's not about owning something virtual; it's about belonging to something real: It's not just ownership; it's stewardship.

Frequently Asked
Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about Stewardship NFTs, rights, benefits, and sustainability.

items.question: What exactly is a Stewardship NFT?
items.answer:
Imagine having a special contract in your digital wallet—a bit like a passport or deed—that shows you are part of something real. It's not just a picture or a token. It's a key. It gives you lifelong rights and tangible benefits linked to a specific piece of land, along with access to the intrinsic value being regenerated on the ground.

The contract is securely and permanently stored on the blockchain, meaning it can't be lost, altered, or faked. Each NFT is unique—like a piece of art—and only a limited number are issued for each land. It's a digital asset with real value that can be transferred.

In addition to securing your rights in relation to the land, the NFT encapsulates the entire legal framework that protects the land itself. It reflects and protects both the Rights of Nature and the role of human stewards, through a groundbreaking model that redefines what land ownership means—shifting it from control to care, from possession to responsibility.

Many believe stewardship will shape the future of economies—and the Inhabit Stewardship NFT is one of the first tools making that vision tangible, linking value creation to care, regeneration, and shared responsibility.

items.question: What rights and benefits do I receive as an NFT holder?
items.answer:
The Stewardship NFT grants you lifetime membership and a living bond between you and a biocultural HUB.

  • • Legal rights as a protector of a Hub
  • • Exclusive artworks
  • • Free accommodation and on-site workshops
  • • Immersive biocultural experiences
  • • Participation in DAO governance
  • • Access to tools to monitor the real impact of your contribution
  • • Exclusive educational contents
  • • Airdrops
  • ...and much more

items.question: Can I transfer or sell my Stewardship NFT?
items.answer: Yes, you can transfer or sell your NFT. The new holder will inherit all stewardship rights and benefits after completing KYC verification and receiving foundation approval.

items.question: When will I be able to access the rights and benefits associated with my membership?
items.answer: You'll be able to access your full stewardship rights and benefits once the campaign reaches its "minimum amount" needed to purchase and restore the land. At that point, the land is tokenized and your benefits are activated. However, the digital artwork included with your NFT is available immediately after your purchase.

items.question: Is using blockchain environmentally sustainable for INHABIT?
items.answer:
Yes — INHABIT uses CELO, a carbon-negative blockchain designed for climate-friendly projects.

Minting all the NFTs needed to finance an INHABIT Hub produces less CO₂ than brewing a single cup of coffee.

Each NFT uses just 0.00001 kWh and emits only 5 mg of CO₂ — less than a Google search.

In comparison:
  • Ethereum (pre-merge) = 15,000× more emissions
  • Bitcoin = 100,000× more
Plus, CELO runs a built-in carbon offset program: a portion of every transaction fee funds verified projects that remove CO₂ from the atmosphere. This makes CELO carbon-negative, meaning it offsets more than it emits — so even our NFTs end up being carbon-negative, turning blockchain into a tool for climate regeneration.

cards.title: Improve
cards.subtitle: Benefits
cards.description: To develop an enhanced and more valuable version of the Stewardship NFT, offering greater benefits to NFT holders while further expanding the corridor.

stewardshipNFTBenefits.title:
What you get
When purchase
stewardshipNFTBenefits.description: A limited-supply digital asset that is transferable and permanent, granting its owner lifelong stewardship and utility rights through a blockchain-verified membership contract.

0.title: Life-long Membership
0.description:
You gain lifelong stewardship and utility rights over tokenized real-world lands.

As an early backer, you'll receive future NFT versions for free as it evolves over time, entitling you to increasing benefits and returns, with added rights and features offered by the Stewardship NFT 2.0—subject to development

1.title: Badge of legal protector
1.description:
You receive a unique Artwork created by an exclusive artist. Each piece represents a Migratory Floating Garden from the ecosystem where the HUB is located, featuring a native animal or plant vital to that habitat.

The unique Art Badge represents your legal stewardship connection to a specific piece of land, granting you access to travel and activate the corridor.

2.title: Legal Protector of the land
2.description:
You become part of a legal system of guarantee that recognises Nature as a subject with rights on a specific piece of land.

This framework, aligned with the Declaration of the Rights of Nature and biocultural principles, helps each of us reclaim our role as guardians of the living ecosystems we depend on—and of which we are an inseparable part.

3.title: Impact Monitoring
3.description:
Track the progress of the land you help protect through real-time data and geolocation narratives.

Follow its transformation into a biocultural hub with regular updates, visual maps, and impact reports. See KPIs on tree planting, biodiversity growth, and local community impact—all showing your contribution to regeneration in action.

4.title: Inhabit DAO access
4.description:
You receive governance rights over specific matters as a land guarantor.

You have a say in decisions involving unexpected changes in land use, shifts in Hub management, or unforeseen events that could affect the relationship between stakeholders and the land—or pose a threat to the Rights of Nature and the integrity of the biocultural mission.

5.title: Exclusive biocultural Access
5.description:
You gain access to biocultural experiences, events, and workshops within the corridor's HUBS, deepening your connection with the land and the bio-culture of a territory.

Benefits include free or discounted stays and meals, exclusive access to unique experiences, and educational content on reforestation, permaculture, bio-construction, and more.

nftWorksSection.title:
How the NFT
Works in two steps
nftWorksSection.description: The NFT's encrypted metadata contain the legal framework, land geolocation, title registry, membership terms, artworks —ensuring permanent protection and stakeholder rights enforcement.

steps.title: Buy an NFT and become a steward
steps.description: You gain lifelong stewardship and utility rights over a specific plot of land, allowing you to monitor and participate in important decisions that affect these ecosystems, and receive exclusive benefits to visit the hubs and explore the whole Corridor.

steps.title: Fund the implementation
steps.description: Funds are used for four key actions: acquiring and protecting degraded lands, restoring their ecosystems, transforming them into thriving biocultural HUBS, and improving our regenerative model to ensure long-term impact, scalability, and glocal community engagement.

projectsVideo.heading: Explore our flagship projects driving regeneration and community empowerment.

items.question: 01 Biodiversity Hotspot – "Living seed hub"
items.answer:
Ñuiyanzhi Hub will regenerate soils affected by degradation and agrochemicals, restoring the full diversity and functionality of these ecosystems and transforming the site into a safe haven for endangered species. The project will restore an inner ecological corridor to support species migration and biodiversity recovery. By planting the widest variety of species, it will create a "living seed bank" that animals and humans can naturally transport and disperse, expanding biodiversity across the landscape.
The important focus on bioclimatic and organic architecture inspired by ancestral Kogui tradition and the use of natural materials will help create conservation areas where humans and other species can coexist, minimising environmental impact, and strengthening the symbiosis between living spaces and nature.

items.question: 02 Land Guardians Incubator – "Learning through living"
items.answer:
Ñuiyanzhi Hub serves as a training center for future land guardians, offering hands-on experience in ecological restoration, bioclimatic architecture, and traditional land practices. Through immersive learning programs that integrate ancestral wisdom with academic and systemic insights, it cultivates a new generation of stewards capable of adapting and replicating these practices in other territories.
The approach emphasises "learning through living," where participants engage directly with the environment, its natural cycles, experiencing the rhythms of daily stewardship and fostering a deep understanding of ecological dynamics and the interconnectedness of all living things. Situated within the Sierra and connected to both the sea and the river, Ñuiyanzhi provides an opportunity to witness ecological restoration firsthand, as evidenced by the return of bird species and the land's recovery under local stewardship. The initiative highlights the role of guardianship, where individuals learn from Indigenous elders who share knowledge rooted in the Law of Origin—an ecological and spiritual framework guiding sustainable coexistence with nature.
By actively participating in this process, trainees not only acquire practical skills but also cultivate a lasting commitment to promoting sustainability and enhancing biodiversity in their own communities. The Ñuiyanzhi experience fosters ecological balance, cultural sustainability, and the principles of Buen Vivir (Good Living), which integrates well-being, sustainability, and reciprocity within the social and ecological fabric.

items.question: 03 Wisdom Hub – "Meeting of knowledge"
items.answer:
Ñuiyanzhi Hub is an Action Research Center for soil restoration and bioclimatic architecture, serving as a space for reflection, exchange, and knowledge production through the encounter between Indigenous Kogui Elders and academics, both dedicated to these research areas. The Hub's spatial development embodies the meeting of knowledge, integrating the Kogui people's values of harmony with nature and contemporary insights.
Through workshops, residencies, seminars, and immersive practices, it facilitates dialogue between local communities, researchers, architects, farmers, and students, promoting a holistic vision of territorial regeneration. This space fosters healing and renewal, acknowledging past impacts, while uniting traditional wisdom with scientific understanding.

items.question: 04 Corridor Pathfinder – "Corridor of Knowledge"
items.answer: Between Tayrona National Park and the Sierra Nevada National Park, between the basins of the Piedras River and the Mendihuaca River, Ñuiyanzhi Hub contributes to the creation of an ecological corridor by reconnecting fragmented landscapes and enabling wildlife movement. The area serves as a corridor for migratory species and mammals such as the Central American agouti (Dasyprocta punctata), as well as critically endangered species like the Blue-billed Curassow (Crax alberti), White-headed Tamarin (Saguinus oedipus), and Howler Monkeys (Alouatta spp.). Through soil regeneration and reforestation, it helps bring back functional ecosystems that connect natural habitats. Additionally, it engages local communities and territorial actors in the co-design of the corridor, mapping and reforesting along the watershed, ensuring ecological continuity and participatory management at bioregional level. Ñuiyanzhi is also committed to extending a corridor of knowledge, sharing and propagating the insights generated through the encounter of diverse knowledge systems along the corridor and beyond.

vision.title: The Vision
vision.text:
Ñuiyanzhi Hub is a sanctuary and land guardians incubator, rooted in nature contemplation and ancestral Kogui wisdom. It blends ecological restoration, bioclimatic design, and traditional land practices, training future stewards through immersive, hands-on learning. As a center for knowledge exchange between Indigenous Elders and researchers, it fosters soil regeneration, sustainable bioconstruction, resource recycling, and cultural continuity. Home to stewards, wildlife, and vital ecosystems, Ñuiyanzhi is a living model of Buen Vivir and ecological stewardship.

Rooted in nature contemplation and biomimicry, the project honors the Kogui people's timeless approach to living in balance with Nature. By blending ancestral wisdom with modern ecological design, Ñuiyanzhi becomes a living lab where future guardians learn through land-based regenerative practice.

guardians.title: The Guardians
guardians.text:
Since 2021, Amelia (Right of Nature Lawyer), Juan (Bio-climatic Architect), and their son León (Nature Monitoring Enthusiast) have stewarded Ñuiyanzhi in collaboration with the Kogi elders of the Kaggaba tribe, traditional authorities of the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. With academic backgrounds and a decade of experience in regenerative rural development, they co-create sustainable solutions rooted in ancestral wisdom that are applied in this HUB.

More than a place, Ñuiyanzhi is a sanctuary—home to a steward family, the Elders of the Sierra, and the birds, monkeys, bees, and plants that safeguard the waters. Ñuiyanzhi is a home for Life—an invitation to care for the Earth with tenderness, responsibility, and awareness

land.title: The Land
land.text:
At its heart, Ñuiyanzhi is restoring a vital inner ecological corridor that connects to the Tayrona and Sierra Nevada National Parks. Through soil regeneration, reforestation, and a living seed bank, it supports the return of endangered species like the Blue-billed Curassow (Paujil) and White-headed Tamarin (Titi Monkey). Merging ancestral Kogui wisdom with scientific practice, it creates shared habitats that honour both ecological and cultural knowledge. This biodiversity hotspot reconnects fragmented landscapes, enabling species migration and ecological stewardship.

Rooted in nature contemplation, the project honors the Kogui people's timeless approach to living in balance with the. By merging ancestral architecture with contemporary bioclimatic design, it fosters sustainable building through bio-construction, responsible use of local materials, and resource recycling.

items.question: What is a biocultural hub?
items.answer:
True and lasting regeneration needs more than tree planting—it requires a deep shift in how we value and care for land. Biocultural Hubs lead this transformation.

HUBS are centers of regeneration and cultural renewal, designed to ignite and cultivate the sense of stewardship needed to restore our planet. HUBS protect biodiversity, train the next generation of land stewards, and weave together ancestral wisdom with contemporary knowledge to drive deep change.

They are spaces where anyone can learn the deepest practices of inhabiting and stewarding nature—places to explore new ways of relating to land, to recognize its many intrinsic values, and to realize the power of our role in nurturing and multiplying them.

Each Hub not only restores ecosystems but is also tasked with expanding a global Corridor by increasing conservation areas through collaboration with nearby hubs, projects, and communities in its bioregion.

HUBS are the building blocks of the Corridor—a worldwide network of biodiversity islands and cultural landmarks. The Corridor wants to inspire a movement of stewardship across the globe.

items.question: What makes a Hub a biodiversity hotspot?
items.answer:
A biodiversity hotspot is a space with exceptionally high levels of biological diversity that is also under significant threat from human activity. Bio-cultural Hubs function as 'living seed hubs'—spaces of critical ecological importance, designed to safeguard and propagate life across the Corridor.

Much like a regional botanical garden, but rooted in the native ecosystems only, each Hub serves as a vital node in a broader network - fostering ecological connectivity across the larger fabric of the Corridor. These hubs allow both people and pollinators to act as living carriers of biodiversity, naturally dispersing seeds, knowledge, and regenerative practices throughout the landscape.

At the heart of each Hub lies an Inner Corridor—a designed ecological pathway that:
• Connects fragmented or degraded landscapes,
• Provides refuge for endangered species,
• Supports the flow of genes, species, and cultural knowledge,
• And strengthens both local resilience and global ecological connectivity.

items.question: What activities take place in a Biocultural Hub?
items.answer:
Biocultural Hubs are vibrant centers where ecological regeneration, cultural renewal, and community engagement converge. Each HUB is unique—shaped by its specific location, ecological context, and guided by the vision of its land guardians. Each Hub is dedicated to a distinct field of knowledge, producing and sharing information that integrates systemic and contemporary knowledge with ancestral wisdom around a specific theme.

Focused on a specific theme—such as ecological restoration, peacebuilding, regenerative entrepreneurship, bioclimatic design, micro-farming, eco-literacy, healing and inner development rooted in biocultural wisdom —just to name a few.

They host place-based activities, hands-on learning experiences across diverse fields of knowledge. NFT Stewards and visitors can design personalized learning journeys, moving across different Hubs in the Corridor—each a wisdom keeper of unique ecological and cultural knowledge.

The INHABIT framework defines 4 key criteria for a site to evolve into a Biocultural Hub, allowing each one to develop its own unique approach and expression of these pillars.

items.question: How are local communities involved?
items.answer:
INHABIT empowers local stewards—often neo-farmers—by granting them permanent land use rights through formal contracts. In return, stewards commit to long-term ecological restoration and cultural protection.

Stewards receive:
• Land security, tied to their commitment to regeneration
• Three years of funding to restore degraded land
• Community support via NFT holders
• Mentorship from INHABIT's expert team

By securing land tenure and investing in changemakers, INHABIT ensures lasting restoration. Stewards, deeply connected to their territories, work in colaboration with Indigenous and local communities to restore ecosystems and preserve biocultural knowledge.

They honor ancestral governance and serve as living bridges between traditional and regenerative practices—educating others in ecological wisdom, cultural memory, and place-based relationships rooted in reciprocity and long-term care.

Through their leadership, ancestral wisdom becomes actionable, inspiring new generations to engage in regeneration with deep cultural and ecological awareness.

items.question: How can I participate in the activities of the Bio-Cultural Hubs?
items.answer:
You can participate by purchasing a Stewardship NFT, which grants you lifetime stewardship of a specific Hub and the whole corridor, and access to its biodiversity-rich lands, programs, and learning experiences. As a life steward, you become part of a community actively supporting the creation of a global regenerative corridor.

Alternatively, you can also join as a visitor, taking part in selected activities, workshops, and immersive experiences offered by each Hub.

nftTable.lifeLongMembershipDesc: You gain lifelong stewardship and utility rights over a tokenized real-world land.
nftTable.legalProtectorDesc: You become part of the legal system of guarantee that recognizes Nature as a subject with rights on a specific land related to this membership, in line with the Declaration of the Rights of Nature and Biocultural principles.
nftTable.daoAccessDesc: You receive governance rights over specific matters as a land guarantor. You have a say in decisions regarding unexpected changes in land use, shifts in Hub management, or any unforeseen events that could alter the relationship between stakeholders and the land or threaten the Rights of Nature.
nftTable.futureUpgradesDesc: As an early backer, you are entitled to receive future versions of the NFT for free, which will include additional rights and benefits as the project evolves in the NFT 2.0 (conditional on development).
nftTable.badgeArt: Badge of legal protector via exclusive ArtWork by Jeisson Castillo
nftTable.badgeArtDesc: Each ArtPiece represents a Migratory Floating Garden from the HUB's ecosystem, featuring a native species vital to that habitat and tied to levels of care in Kogui ancestral thinking. The unique Art Badge symbolizes your legal stewardship connection to a specific piece of land, which you can use to travel and activate the corridor.
nftTable.monitoringAccess: Impact Monitoring access via MAP HERE
nftTable.monitoringAccessDesc: Track the progress of the land you help protect through real-time data mapping and geolocation narratives. Follow the transformation of the land into a Biocultural hub. You receive regular real-time data and impact reports, geolocation, visual mapping, and key performance indicators (KPIs) detailing progress in areas like tree planting, biodiversity increase, and local community impact.

hubs.title: biocultural
hubs.description: HUBS are like 'Migratory Gardens'—they exist in the real world but behave differently; they are 'spaces of transition', to experiment ways of relating to ourselves and nature. Places to learn the deepest practices for inhabiting and stewarding lands

stewardship.title: Stewardship
stewardship.description: The Stewardship NFT aims to revolutionise restoration by pioneering a new conservation model that actively involves everyone—offering real benefits and opportunities to reconnect with nature through hands-on ecological stewardship

about.title: About
about.description: Our vision is to contribute to the conservation and regeneration of biocultural diversity by facilitating the creation of a global physical corridor that protects vital ecosystems and drives rural social innovation

nuiyanzhi.title: Ñuiyanzhi
nuiyanzhi.description: By healing degraded soils and reforesting key areas, it restores ecosystem functionality and creates a refuge for endangered species, enabling wildlife movement through an inner ecological corridor that reconnects fragmented landscapes.

projects.title: Our
projects.description: Discover the initiatives and collaborations that are driving real-world impact. Our projects span ecosystem restoration, biocultural innovation, and community empowerment each one a step toward a regenerative future.

projectsMain.heading: Explore our flagship projects driving regeneration and community empowerment.

project1.label: Food Forest
project1.title: SEWINDUA CORRIDOR
project1.description: Was established in 2024 by the INHABIT Foundation. Located in the heart of Palomino, the corridor serves as a sanctuary for biodiversity, designed to support pollinators and wildlife.
project1.visionText: Home to over 140 native tree species, it restores different strata of a dry tropical forest, transitioning into a humid ecosystem. The corridor also features a Food Forest with more than 60 native fruit and nut species from the Caribbean, alongside an agroecological intensive mandala food garden, fostering regenerative agriculture and local food sovereignty.

project2.label: Agroecology
project2.title: ARTE SELVA
project2.description: Transforming degraded lands into productive food forests, this project combines traditional knowledge with modern agroecology for food security and resilience.
project2.visionText: ArteSelva is a program that embodies a unique approach to creating biological corridors and botanical gardens—biodiversity hotspots enriched by experimental ArtScape pathways designed to awaken environmental consciousness and invite immersive, multi-sensory experiences that deepen our connection to nature.

faq.title:
Frequently Asked
Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about Biocultural Hubs, conservation, and NFT impact.

items.question: How do Biocultural Hubs contribute to conservation?
items.answer:
• • Biodiversity Protection: They safeguard biodiversity by protecting vital ecosystems and restoring habitats for endangered and native species. As "living seed hubs," they help propagate life across the Corridor.
  • • Land Restoration: They restore degraded lands through reforestation, soil regeneration, watershed protection, and the spread of ecological knowledge.
  • • Indigenous Knowledge: They revitalize Indigenous knowledge by collaborating with local communities to honor and share ancestral practices.
  • • Ecological Connectivity: They expand ecological corridors by connecting fragmented habitats and fostering connectivity across the bioregion.
  • • Rural Innovation: They promote rural innovation by serving as labs for regenerative practices and sustainable, place-based living.
  • • Community Empowerment: They empower local stewards through training and community-led governance.
  • • Land Tenure Models: They introduce new models of land tenure, recognizing the Rights of Nature and long-term stewardship responsibilities.
  • • Shared Conservation: They redefine conservation as shared responsibility—where NFT holders gain legal stewardship and take part in real-world regeneration through biocultural engagement.

items.question: How does my NFT purchase help conservation?
items.answer:
Your NFT purchase directly supports real-world conservation and regeneration. The Corridor is designed to spark a global movement of ecological stewardship, and your contribution plays a vital role.

85% of funds go directly to:

  • PROTECT: Purchase and permanently safeguards lands under the INHABIT groundbreaking legal framework, recognising ecosystems as legal entities with protected rights, while providing specific rights and benefits to individuals who support its regeneration.
  • RESTORE: Finance long-term ecosystem regeneration through stewardship-based land restoration with three-year programs, restoring the full diversity and functionality of the ecosystem—not just planting trees.
  • TRANSFORM: Develop thriving bio-cultural hubs dedicated to unique fields of knowledge, fostering the production and dissemination of wisdom, and actively expand the corridor.
  • IMPROVE: To develop an enhanced and more valuable version of the Stewardship NFT, offering greater benefits to NFT holders while further expanding the corridor (NFT 2.0).

items.question: What happens if the minimum amount needed to purchase the land and finance the project is not reached?
items.answer: If the minimum amount needed to purchase the land isn't reached within 12 months, the INHABIT Foundation may use the funds to acquire a smaller plot and establish a smaller HUB. If that's not possible, a full refund will be offered (minus fees), in the same currency used for the purchase. Members will be kept informed at all phases throughout the process, including funding progress, land acquisition decisions, and any updates regarding the use of funds or potential refunds.

items.question: How is transparency and security ensured in the use of the funds raised?
items.answer: Each project follows a clearly defined and pre-approved budget and implementation plan, as detailed in the official Whitepaper and Project Plan documentation specific to each HUB. Transparency is guaranteed through the integration of blockchain technology and secure smart contracts, which make all fund transactions traceable, tamper-proof, and publicly auditable. Funds are securely held, and their disbursement is governed by transparent accounting and reporting procedures, ensuring visibility and accountability for all stakeholders and contributors.

items.question: What guarantees the land is protected in perpetuity?
items.answer:
INHABIT's legal framework ensures permanent land protection through a layered system that integrates the Rights of Nature, tokenized governance, smart contracts, and on-the-ground stewardship:

  • 1-Rights of Nature: Land is legally recognized as a rights-bearing entity. Once tokenized, it cannot be sold or exploited, ensuring lasting protection.
  • 2-Stewardship NFTs: Each NFT links to a legal membership contract. Holders gain governance rights to monitor land, intervene if nature is at risk, and help shape decisions—using geolocated storytelling and KPIs for real-time verification.
  • 3-On-the-ground Stewards: Local stewards receive permanent land use rights and ensure daily ecological care and protection.
  • 4-Smart Contracts: Rights and responsibilities (including Nature's) are enforced through transparent, immutable contracts that encode legal instruments and allow digital and physical governance.
  • 5-Institutional Oversight: INHABIT SAS and the INHABIT Foundation oversee fund use, legal compliance, and rights enforcement, with documents encrypted on-chain.

termsAndConditionsPage.title: Terms of Use
termsAndConditionsPage.subtitle: These Terms of Use and Conditions (“Terms”) govern your access to and use of the INHABIT website, platform, and associated services operated by INHABIT CO S.A.S. (“INHABIT,” “we,” “our,” or “us”). By accessing www.inhabit.one or any related content, you agree to be bound by these Terms.

1.title: Acceptance of Terms
1.text: By using our website or services, you accept and agree to these Terms and our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree, please do not use the Service.

2.title: Use of the Website and Platform
2.text: You may use the Service only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms. You agree not to:

list.1: Engage in unauthorized use, access, or tampering with systems, data, or content
list.2: Interfere with the functionality or security protocols of the platform
list.3: Use the platform for any fraudulent, abusive, or harmful activities
list.4: Impersonate any person or entity or misrepresent your affiliation
list.5: Violate intellectual property rights or any applicable laws

3.title: Intellectual Property
3.text: All materials and content on the Service—including but not limited to text, graphics, branding, smart contracts, and multimedia—are the exclusive property of INHABIT CO S.A.S. or its licensors. You are granted a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable license to access and use this content for personal, non-commercial purposes only. You may not:

list.1: Reproduce, redistribute, publish, or exploit any content without prior written permission
list.2: Use INHABIT's logos, names, or trademarks without express authorization
list.3: Modify, reverse engineer, or create derivative works based on the Service

4.title: NFT and Digital Asset Disclaimer
4.text: By engaging with INHABIT NFTs or other blockchain-integrated elements of the platform, you acknowledge and accept that:

list.1: INHABIT does not store or control private keys, wallets, or the underlying blockchain infrastructure
list.2: INHABIT is not liable for any losses due to failed NFT transactions, wallet breaches, or third-party exchanges
list.3: NFT functionality may depend on smart contracts and blockchain operations beyond our control

5.title: Rights and Benefits of NFT Holders
5.text: All rights, benefits, and obligations related to holding an INHABIT NFT are governed by the Membership Contract agreed to at the time of acquisition. This contract outlines, among other provisions:

list.1: The right to transfer or resell the NFT via compatible platforms and marketplaces
list.2: A non-exclusive, non-commercial license to display, share, or use the associated artwork for personal purposes
list.3: Access to specific utilities, events, content, programs, and stewardship-related benefits as defined by INHABIT

5.note: The scope of these rights is subject to the terms of the Membership Contract. NFT holders are encouraged to consult their Membership Contract for full details.

6.title: User-Generated Content
6.text: If you submit or share content (e.g., testimonials, feedback, photos, ideas), you grant INHABIT a perpetual, royalty-free, global license to use, reproduce, modify, and display such content across any medium. You warrant that:

list.1: You have the rights and permissions to share such content
list.2: The content does not infringe on any third party's rights

7.title: Termination of Access
7.text: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your access to the Service at any time, without prior notice, if you violate these Terms, applicable laws, or for any other reason at our sole discretion.

8.title: Limitation of Liability
8.text: To the fullest extent permitted by law, INHABIT shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising from:

list.1: Your use or inability to use the Service
list.2: Errors, bugs, or omissions on the platform
list.3: Unauthorized access, hacking, or misuse of data

9.title: Indemnification
9.text: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless INHABIT, its directors, officers, employees, affiliates, and partners from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, costs, or legal fees arising from your use of the Service or violation of these Terms.

10.title: Changes to Terms
10.text: We may update these Terms at any time without prior notice. Changes become effective once posted. Your continued use of the Service constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

11.title: Governing Law and Jurisdiction
11.text: These Terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of Colombia. Any dispute or claim arising out of or related to these Terms shall be resolved exclusively in the courts of Cali, Valle del Cauca.
